Description: Part of rim, neck and body of translucent white and yellow-brown calcite jar with banding cut horizontally: ledge-shaped rim and one solid oval lug preserved above splayed lappet below shoulder; Egyptian vessel with part of engraved quadrilingual cuneiform inscription of Xerxes I in Old Persian, Elamite and Babylonian; polished exterior; base missing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Susa, Found in the nothern part of the citadel mound.
